alert.note: Alert for Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 08 at 9:31PM EDT until September 09 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Tazewell County in southwestern Virginia... * Until 330 AM EDT. * At 931 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen through the evening. The expected rainfall rate at times will be 1.5 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area through midnight. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bluefield... Pocahontas... Boissevain... Tiptop... This includes the following streams and drainages... South Fork Clinch River, Laurel Creek, North Fork Clinch River, Laurel Fork, Bluestone River, West Fork Cove Creek and East Fork Cove Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
